VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Shopping Cart Page

The Shopping Cart page shows all the products that a buyer has added to the active cart. The buyer can change quantities, move items to a wish list, apply a coupon code, and proceed to the Checkout page. The Shopping Cart page can also include options for sending the cart contents as an email and requesting a quote.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 only
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)
NOTE
Version 2.0 of the Shopping Cart page replaced the legacy version 1.0 in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10). For better performance, easier extension, and ongoing support, we recommend that new implementations always use version 2.0. If necessary for compatibility purposes, you can optionally re-enable version 1.0.
The information in these help topics applies only to the Shopping Cart page version 2.0.
WARNING When a buyer enters checkout, the ccrz.ccLogicCartSave logic service provider class in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API executes and performs critical updates to the current CC Cart record. To avoid potential validation errors, use care when you extend or replace this default logic.
Configure Product Info and Options on the Shopping Cart Page
Provide an efficient, helpful experience for buyers as they review the products in their shopping cart and prepare to check out. You can specify how much information and which options are available for each product listed on the Shopping Cart page.
Show Coupon Information on the Shopping Cart Page
If your storefront supports coupons, provide an intuitive experience for buyers to apply a specific coupon code on their cart and review the coupon's discount.
Allow a Buyer to Email the Contents of the Shopping Cart Page
Support a buyer whose workflow includes sending a copy of their shopping cart contents through email. You can allow a guest or registered buyer to easily generate an email from the Shopping Cart page, with the contents included in an attached PDF. You can customize some elements of the PDF, including text labels and logo.
Allow a Buyer to Request a Quote for the Contents of the Shopping Cart
If your storefront restricts which buyers can complete checkout, you can allow a guest or registered buyer to request a quote for a particular cart. B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates a corresponding lead or opportunity record, depending on whether the buyer is a guest or an authenticated user. You can configure certain options for the quote request, such as which buyers can complete the request and what information is required.
Allow a Buyer to Change a Product's Quantity to Zero on the Shopping Cart Page
Provide an intuitive experience for a buyer who wants to remove a product from their cart on the Shopping Cart page. You can provide the option for a buyer to change a product's quantity in the cart to zero, which removes the product from the cart. You can also specify whether the buyer receives a prompt to confirm the change.
Show Related Products on the Shopping Cart Page
Encourage buyers to add other products to their cart before they proceed to the Checkout page. Set up a cross-sell relationship from one product to another. When a buyer adds the first product to their cart, the second product appears in a separate widget on the Shopping Cart page.
Optimize How Frequently the Shopping Cart Page Calls Price Logic
Provide a smooth buyer experience on the Shopping Cart page and gain more precise control over your org's resources. Specify the condition that triggers the Shopping Cart page to call pricing logic in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API for updating cart item prices. Implement a reprice strategy that satisfies your solution's requirements but avoids unnecessary, expensive calls to the pricing logic.
Extension Points for the Shopping Cart Page
To modify the default behavior for how the Shopping Cart page populates data, extend or override the appropriate API classes and methods or handlebars.js template. The extension points apply to the Scaled Cart page or the Shopping Cart page version 2.0, but not the Shopping Cart page version 1.0.
